channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes in Woodlands Road, Warden Hill., 9th January
item.description:
Potholes in Woodlands Road outside Nos 11 and 2. Heavy rainfall has scoured out former pothole repairs. Road in shocking condition. Contractors when authorised need to sweep up and take away debris.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Woodlands Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris in road. See photo., 9th January
item.description:
See photo. My pint sized water bottle for scale. Completely avoidable if the road was actually repaired properly rather than continuous patching. This is a through road that gets lots of use during rush hour and school drop off.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 9th January
item.description:
Customer called to report that all works and reinstatement appears complete at location - requesting the temp lights be removed
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 9th January
item.description:
the South of Kayte Lane is chaos due to the temp lights and are badly coordinated. There does not seem to be any sign of people even working at these lights since they were up at the start of the week. This is having an even worse effect on the situation as the A435 is closed from highways and New Road is closed from the Severn Trent pipe work. Why are these temp lights allowed to be put up when the other roads are closed and no one is doing any work. The temp lights are for 'private building work' (see attached map from one.network).
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles
